For over 30 years, Old Town Trolley has provided award-winning sightseeing tours highlighting the best of the city. "See the best first" aboard a green and orange trolley! Featuring 22 stops to bring you close to one hundred points of interest in St. Augustine. All tours are 100% live in real time - No pre-recorded narration The finest, most highly-trained, and knowledgeable guides Unlimited hop-on & hop-off as often as you like all day long Proudly owned and operated in the United States FREE Admission to St. Augustine History Museum FREE Beach Shuttle to Alligator Farm and the Beach Park for free and board at the Old Town complex located at 167 San Marco Ave. Discount attraction tickets and tour packages also available. Nights of Lights St. Augustine Holiday Tours by Old Town Trolley Click for possible tour/info changes on the day of your tour. View info. 904-337-3780 Manage Booking Gift Cards Nights of Lights Highlights Schedule Contest Elf Hunt FAQs Performances Connect call us loading Chat with an agent Manage BUY TICKETS TIX Menu TICKETS Close Home Buy Tickets Light Up the Night Contest Holiday Tree Contest Performance Calendar Contact Us Gift Cards Travel Guide Join Our Cast Back ADDRESS 10 W Castillo Dr St. Augustine, FL 32084 PHONE 904-337-3780 LET’S CONNECT Facebook Instagram youtube ACCESIBILITY Old Town Trolley’s Nights of Lights Tour A Holiday Tradition Celebrating 32 Years The holidays are popular for enjoying time-honored traditions like gift-giving, bonding with family, and decorating your home in the spirit of the season. Here in America’s Oldest City, we take the latter to a whole different level. Inspired by an ancient holiday practice brought here by the Spanish of displaying lit candles on window sills, The Annual Nights of Lights is set to brighten up the holidays in The Ancient City once again! To experience the glow of the season and the more than 3 million sparkling white lights adorning every corner of the city, stretching for nearly 20 blocks, take a ride on Old Town Trolley’s Nights of Lights Tour! Spend less time waiting in line and more time with your loved ones… Reserve a private row for you and your family or for that special someone and your Nights of Lights Trolley will be waiting for you when you arrive. LEARN MORE Best Seasonal Attraction Old Town Trolley’s Nights of Lights Tour is proud to have been awarded the 2025 Best Seasonal Attraction by “Best of St. Augustine”. St. Augustine’s Sparkling Tradition Let’s Take a Ride Play Video SHOWCASING OUR Tour Highlights Holiday Cheer You’ll be caroling to your favorite holiday music! Magical Glasses Our complimentary glasses will enhance the glimmer of the lights and include over $100 of money saving coupons. Treats Complimentary sugar cookies and warm apple cider. SAVE THE DATES Tour Schedule Sunday, November 16, 2025 – Sunday, January 11, 2026. Tours depart from the Visitor Information Center, 10 West Castillo Drive. Approx. 30-45 minutes. Times vary by date. See calendar for times. Reservations are required. Don’t forget to wear your complimentary magical viewing glasses for an enhanced, fully immersive holiday experience. Did you know?… The coupons on your Nights of Lights glasses are valued at over $100 in savings! BUY TICKETS One of the 10 Best Holiday Lighting Displays in the World National Geographic Traveler One of the 12 Favorite Places to Catch the Holiday Spirit AAA Auto Club One of the Top 100 Events in the Country American Bus Association Best Seasonal Attraction Best of St. Augustine St. Augustine with its Nights of Lights festival is one of the best cities to visit at Christmas. Conde Nast Traveler One of the 23 Best Christmas Light Displays in the U.S. U.S. News & World Report Prev Next THIRTEENTH ANNUAL Light Up the Night Contest! Each year guests of the Old Town Trolley are asked to help choose the city’s Top 3 lighting displays. Winners of these prestigious awards will receive cash, prizes and one of the most sought-after trophies in the city! ENTER CONTEST Wrap Up a Holiday Favorite Make spirits bright with a Nights of Lights Gift Card. Friends and family can enjoy the magic of the season with a tour that brings holiday lights to life. It’s a festive and flexible gift for anyone on your list. BUY GIFT CARDS Join Our Elf Hunt Deep in the heart of the North Pole, Santa’s elves have toiled tirelessly to weave magic into the holiday season for children far and wide! To reward the elves for their hard work, Santa granted the elves a magical vacation in the enchanted land of St. Augustine to enjoy the World-Famous Nights of Lights. Amidst their joyous frolics, however, the playful elves have become separated and now seek your helping hand to reunite them. Santa Promises a Special Reward at the End of Your Tour... If you can help find the elves amongst the more than 3 million sparkling white lights, Santa promises a special reward at the end of your tour. May luck and merriment guide your path! Holiday Tree Decorating Contest Old Town Trolley Tours is proud to be partnering with the St. Johns County School District and INK!, a non-profit support organization that works with the district, for their Holiday Tree Program. LEARN MORE Must-Read Travel Guide Looking for things to do around town? From local favorites to must-see highlights, explore insider tips and ideas to make the most of your time in St. Augustine. Discover top attractions, hidden gems, and unique experiences that make the Ancient City so memorable. Whether you’re planning a quick weekend getaway or a longer stay, our articles have something for every traveler looking to explore St. Augustine. LEARN MORE QUESTIONS? WE HAVE ANSWERS! FAQs How do the tickets for Nights of Lights Tours work? Tickets for Nights of Lights Tours are priced per trolley row with 1-4 guests allowed per row. The row is your group’s private row and will not be mixed with other guests. Reservations are required. Reservation-based tickets are non-refundable. You may reschedule up to 24 hours in advance of tour time by calling 904-337-3780. Maximum of 4 guests per row. What are the official Nights of Lights Tour dates this year? Sunday, November 16, 2025 – Sunday, January 11, 2026. – Tours run for approx. 30-45 minutes. Times vary by date. See calendar for times. Why are tickets sold by trolley row instead of individually? To ensure our guests can sit together and fully enjoy the experience, we offer tickets by the entire Trolley Row rather than individual seats. Each row can accommodate up to (4) four guests. The row is your group’s private row and will not be mixed with other guests. This approach guarantees a more seamless and enjoyable holiday journey for everyone. Where do Nights of Lights Tours depart from? Tours depart from the Visitor Information Center, 10 West Castillo Drive. Are there age requirements for children? Children 3 years and younger may be considered a lap child. Toddler carriers and children ages 4 and older are required to have their own seat and must remain seated at all times. Where is the best place to park for Nights of Lights Tours? Parking is not included with the tour. Discount parking for trolley guests is available at the nearby Old Town Trolley Welcome Center, 27 San Marco Ave., on a first come, first served basis. 24 hours a day parking is available at the adjacent Historic Downtown Parking Facility. Cash, credit, and debit cards are all accepted. Are Nights of Lights Tours handicap accessible? Many, but not all our Trolleys are equipped with lifts that can accommodate one scooter or wheelchair each. For guests using wheelchairs or scooters, we kindly request at least 24 hours’ notice to accommodate your needs. Please contact us at (904) 829-3800 to schedule in advance. This will ensure we can provide a properly equipped vehicle for your comfort and convenience. Wheelchair-accessible trolleys are scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis. Are food and drinks allowed while on the tour? Food and drinks are welcome. However alcoholic beverages are not allowed under any circumstance for the safety and comfort of all of our guests. What language are the tours in? All of our tours are in English only. Can I bring my stroller onboard the trolley? Yes, we can accommodate most regular-size strollers, but they must be collapsible and fit in your row with your party. Strollers may also be left with the attendant at the tour entrance and can be retrieved at the end of the ride. Please note, however, that we are not responsible for any lost or stolen items. How do I purchase group tickets? Do you offer private charters? How many people are needed for a group discount? For private transportation or groups of 15 or more, please call our Groups & Charters Department at (904) 829-3800. Is the trolley covered if it's raining? Will I get wet? Do tours run if it's raining? We will run as normal during rainy weather and free rain ponchos are available by asking a CASTmember. Is the tour narrated? Does the driver talk? The tour has minimal narration, as you’ll be immersed in the holiday spirit—singing along to your favorite festive music and marveling at the stunning lights through your complimentary Magical Glasses! Do I need to bring a car seat aboard? My child is in a car seat do I have to bring it? Children in car seats can safely sit on your lap or beside you. Do you sell gift certificates? Can I buy a gift certificate? We do not offer gift certificates, but the ticket can be booked for a certain date then rescheduled as needed. Is the trolley heated? Trolleys are open-air and are not heated. Feel free to bring a blanket and at the end of the tour we will provide complimentary hot apple cider to warm you up! What is the tour route? The Nights of Lights tour takes you through the heart of the Historic District, along the scenic Bayfront by the Castillo de San Marcos, and through the Plaza de la Constitución. How do I report a lost and found item? Do you have a lost and found? To report a lost item or return an item you’ve found, please contact us at [email protected] . Do the trolleys have air conditioning? The trolleys are open-air and do not have air conditioning. Do you allow pets? Can I bring my dog? Do you allow service animals? Do you allow emotional support animals? Service animals are the only animals that are allowed on board the trolleys. A service animal means a dog, regardless of breed or type, that is individually trained to do work or perform tasks for the benefit of a qualified individual with a disability, including a physical, sensory, psychiatric, intellectual, or other mental disability. Animal species other than dogs, emotional support animals, comfort animals, companionship animals, and service animals in training are not service animals and not allowed on the tour. 2025 Performance Calendar Sponsored by Old Town Trolley Tours, all groups perform nightly at the Old Town Trolley Nights of Lights Guest Queuing Area – Visitor Information Center. Murder Mystery Trolley: Who Killed the Circus Queen? $ 58.99 On this 90-minute interactive tour, solve the mystery of the Circus Queen’s murder in a fun, circus-themed theatrical show aboard the trolley. Book Now Learn More Hour Glass 90 minutes Calendar Year Round Calendar Browse Our Full Calendar Featured Trolley Tours & Special Events Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour Most popular daytime tour! $ 54.99 Hour Glass 90 minutes Calendar Year Round Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour On this classic Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour, learn where to tour, dine, shop or visit! Learn about Sarasota’s famous murders, haunted buildings, and unsolved crimes on this fun trolley tour. Keep an eye out for surprise guests along the way! Book Now Learn More Literature & Lattes From $ 53.99 Hour Glass 2 hours Literature & Lattes POP UP Experience: Discover the rich literary history of Sarasota on this fun NEW tour, Literature & Lattes , with our partners at Bookstore1 and Jessie’s Café located at The Reserve. Learn about the wine made at Fiorelli, sample several of their wines and add on a lunch option to eat while you enjoy the music in the gardens. Christmas Carol Trolley : Letters To Santa is a musical, holiday adventure tour featuring our singing cast members, The Trolley Troubadours. Book Now Learn More View All Our Trolley Tours Most weekday tours run in Dolly The Trolley , our 31-seat, enclosed & air-conditioned trolley. If you book through us directly and need to reschedule, we will be happy to do that for you with a $10 per ticket rebooking fee. We encourage you to book with us directly, as this option is not available on tickets booked through affiliates. Buy a Gift Certificate Gift Certificates About Discover Sarasota Tours Discover Sarasota Tours is a locally-owned tour company offering many entertaining, interactive, and informative air-conditioned trolley tours about the most interesting people, intriguing places, and amazing stories that have shaped Sarasota & Venice’s rich cultural past. If you are looking for a fun activity for your next group outing, look no further. Our tours are perfect for groups. Check out our Group Tours page. Our tours run year-round, but during our hottest months of the summer, we don’t run all tours every day, so please check the calendar. If there is a date not listed when you would like to tour, please email us at [email protected] . Learn More About Us Our Tours Are Great for Groups! See Group Tour Options As Featured In (opens in new window) (opens in new window) (opens in new window) (opens in new window) The Best Sightseeing Trolley Tours in Sarasota & Venice Don't stop bringing the fun! Sing-Along Tour Thank you, Tammy at Discover Sarasota Tours, for such a fun experience! I never thought getting on a trolley singing and dancing could be so much fun! We laughed, we sang, we danced and just enjoyed the ride! – Kelly Stilwell (Bradenton Magazine) A Wonderful Energy – May 2025 Psychic Sundays Tour My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed the Psychic Sunday Tour. First of all, we were greeted with a mimosa at the Trolley Cottage. As we joined our group on the porch, a wonderful energy developed. Deni, our tarot master and intuitive reader, shared some information of what to expect. The trolley was air conditioned, a positive this time of year. As to the content of the tour, it touched on three different facets of what’s available in the area. Deni is really a master in her field. I would highly recommend if this is a field of interest. – Christine B. (TripAdvisor) You won't be disappointed Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour We went with a small group of “locals” on the Discover Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour. What a great time! First, the folks at Discover Sarasota are just delightful to work with. They are so friendly and informative and you can tell that they really enjoy being there and interacting with their guests. There’s a quirky little gift shop that’s fun to browse, with a restroom to use before the tour which is 90 minutes. The tour trolley is clean, and pretty, and best of all air conditioned. Our tour guide (I’m so sorry I don’t remember his name. He is originally from Dublin, Ireland.) was just absolutely great. He gave us lots of information and was entertaining and enthusiastic. Even as locals we all learned a lot of things we didn’t know. Take a Discover Sarasota Tour and you won’t be disappointed. – Janice L. (TripAdvisor) Best in the US City Tour (In our opinion!) Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour OMG- We have been on many city tours across the country, but this particular tour was the best of all. Our tour guide, Jon and driver Kelly were just fantastic. We learned so very much about the city we didn’t know and we live here. Bus ride was nicely air conditioned, driving was excellent and Jon, our guide, was the best. Jon is an amazing wealth of knowledge regarding the area and has lived in Sarasota since the 70s. We weren’t sure how he could remember so much information.

…Well worth the money. We will for sure be going on other tours in the future. – Spartan Fan (TripAdvisor) All around fantastic Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour What a fantastic way to learn about Sarasota! Jon was engaging, funny and very knowledgable. Nice air conditioned trolleys that were clean and comfortable. Good insider tips on other things to do and see around town. This felt like a personalized tour from a close friend. You won’t be disappointed. Well done. – Leigh J, Tripadvisor (Mar 2025) Wonderful Event! I want to thank you again for curating a wonderful event. The team learned a lot, had a blast, and felt appreciated! – Shannon This is a MUST do tour in Sarasota! Amish Experience: Bridges to Understanding This trolley tour of the Amish areas of Sarasota is fantastic! As you will see from my profile, we have done many tours all over the world, and this was one of our favourite tours anywhere. I can't say enough about our guide, Kendra. She was charming, well-spoken and entertaining. She provided so much information about the Amish people. She has many family members who are Amish so has first hand knowledge and stories to share. This made the tour really special. I can't recall the last time I listened to a tour guide so intently. Not a dull moment the entire time. I highly recommend this tour! Thanks Kendra and Discover Sarasota Tours. – CAM1202, Tripadvisor (Feb 2025) Great overview of Sarasota Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour Steve was very informative and entertaining. The tour brought us to places that we were not familiar with even after living here for 8 years. We brought my 95 year old Dad who was visiting from up north. He enjoyed the tour. This is a great way for new residents to get an overview of the area. It's also a great way to introduce your guests to the city. – Stephen I, Tripadvisor (Feb 2025) Fun Valentines Evening Art Crawl Trolley We had a great few hours on the Art Crawl Trolley - visited many galleries that we pass by on a daily basis but never stopped into. Everyone at Discover Sarasota were so friendly and helpful that it makes we want to volunteer for some of their trolley tours. AND we learned about the Lime Light District ! I have lived in Sarasota for 8 years and never heard about that area - what a gem. Thank you all for a fun Valentines evening. Elizabeth & Doug – Elizabeth R, TripAdvisor (Feb 2025) Fabulous tour Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour What a great time we had with our tour guide , Ed and driver, Paul. Ed was so knowledgeable and gave us tons of information in a way that was entertaining and interesting. Paul navigated around all the traffic which was particularly busy due to the boat show and Saturday Farmer’s market. We had a blast and highly recommend this company and the city tour. Ed is so engaging and clearly loves Sarasota. It was one of the highlights of our trip. – Brenda Informative. Amish Experience Tour: Bridges to Understanding This was our third tour with Discover Sarasota and they get better every time. We have always been aware of the large Amish presence in Sarasota but really knew very little about the Amish here or in our native Pennsylvania. Our guide, Lois, was extremely knowledgeable and informative. She comes from an Amish family and has a lot of first hand knowledge. We visited Pinecraft, which is a vacation destination for the Amish from up north. We saw the Carlisle Hotel, which is top rated. We also visited a quilting shop and der Dutchman Restaurant. Our tour went a little overtime which was fine, because Lois had lots of interesting information to relate. After the tour went went back to the restaurant and had a wonderful lunch. – Rob P (Jan 2025) Great for Locals and Visitors Alike Sarasota City Sightseeing Tour If you’re local to Sarasota, don’t wait for out of town guests to find an excuse to take a Discover Sarasota trolley tour. This summer and fall, we already have booked the city tour, the murder mystery tour, and the circus tour. This fall we’ll be watching to book the Christmas lights tour. And don’t forget the architectural tour. The city is rich with sights. Get out and Discover Sarasota. – Mark S. A Spiritual Day Psychic Sundays Tour Michael was amazing, so much knowledge of the Spiritual History of Sarasota. The whole experience was just relaxing and informative. Thank you for a wonderful day. – Pam (Jun 2022) Sarasota Trolley Tours are fun learning experience for residents and a great activity to take visitors. Amish Experience Tour: Bridges to Understanding The Amish Experience Tour: Bridges to Understanding is an excellent way to understand the history and culture of the community. Kendra is a wonderful guide and narrator, informative and very personable. I highly recommend this tour option and several of the others on which I have participated. – Gwen C, Tripadvisor (Jan 2025) The best activity I’ve done in Sarasota in 5 years Sunset Cabaret Outstanding experience, absolutely great. Would highly recommend them. Very interesting and entertaining, you can’t go wrong. – Scott S (Apr 2024) Perfect ladies day out!! Leading Ladies of Sarasota Both the owner of Discover Sarasota, Tammy Hauser, and Jerry Chesley, the art historian, were very knowledgeable and accommodating. A party atmosphere while obtaining knowledge is an absolute winner! – Diane B. (Apr 2024) Great circus memories Circus Secrets of Venice The Venice Circus tour was interesting and informative. Our tour guide, Bob, really knows the circus history well and relates it in an enthusiastic way. There are not many circus remnants still remaining, but Bob brings a lot of it to life through memories. The circus train car is also fun to visit as is the train station. Venice is a beautiful town that still has some Florida charm of yesteryears. Well worth your time. – Trish H. (Jan 2025) Circus Secrets and more Revealed! Excellent, informative tour! Circus Secrets of Sarasota The tour guide Bob told some really great stories of the impact on the circus in Sarasota, FL. He had first hand knowledge of the Ringling circus. I really loved the personal artifacts and photos he passed around during the trolley tour. The trolley is a fun summer activity. The trolley driver did an excellent job of getting us around Sarasota… The house where you check in for the trolley is filled with great vintage gifts and books. Looking forward to taking many more tours. Thank you. – Colleen Sarasota Public art tour so enjoyable Public Art Tour This is my 4th trip with them. Such a packed education on so, so many sculptures and murals. I went home and read more about them. – Linda H. BEST birthday party we’ve ever attended. Murder Mystery Trolley: Who Killed The Circus Queen? This was the absolute BEST birthday party we’ve ever attended. The staff and actors were amazing– we laughed, and laughed and laughed some more! Celebrating Michael’s birthday was a hoot! – Anonymous Great FUN!!! Art Crawl Trolley We had a BLAST! What a fun evening. Very impressed with how well organized the tour was ... guides on each trolley, greeters at each stop, and happy people at each gallery. WONDERFUL time!!! – Adventure105793, TripAdvisor (Jan 2025) Mummies, Murder, and Mayhem – Oh My! Haunted Sarasota Tour Sarasota Tours are a great way to get a group together for a night of fun social entertainment. The tour guide shared her personal anecdotes about Sarasota’s spooky history. The actor who came on board was the hit of the party, especially in the third act (no spoilers). This was our second group trolley tour outing and with the complimentary parking, beer, and wine this event is a great value. – Martha R. WOW! WAS THIS EVER A FUN TRIP! Christmas Carol Trolley: Letters To Santa We usually drive around and look at lights… BUT this was far more spirit-filling! It’s now an every year tour for us! – Barbara L-O. Explore St. Augustine’s Enchanting History :: Old Town Trolley Tours Southern Oaks Inn Menu Accommodations Our Rooms Comparison Chart Amenities Policies Accessibility Statement Dogs Offers Specials Enhancements Gift Certificates Groups Private Events Weddings Inquiry Form Experiences Area Activities Travel Blog The Inn About Us Map & Directions FAQs Photo Gallery Breakfast Home Home Accommodations Amenities & Policies Dogs Special Offers Private Events Weddings Experiences Travel Blog About Us Photo Gallery Breakfast Gift Certificates Reservations Call Book Reservations Previous Next St. Augustine Travel Blog Explore St. Augustine’s Enchanting History with Old Town Trolley Tours Exploring St. Augustine with Old Town Trolley Tours Immerse yourself in the captivating history and charm of St. Augustine, Florida, aboard the iconic Old Town Trolley Tours. This convenient and fun-filled hop-on, hop-off trolley service allows you to discover the city’s vibrant past and hidden gems at your own pace, making it an ideal choice for families, history buffs, and anyone seeking a unique sightseeing experience. A Narrated Adventure Through History Travel back in time as you embark on a narrated journey through St. Augustine’s historic streets. Knowledgeable guides onboard each trolley share fascinating stories and insights about the city’s diverse cultural heritage, from its Spanish colonial roots to its vibrant present-day charm. With 21 conveniently located stops throughout the city, Old Town Trolley Tours offer ultimate flexibility. Explore iconic landmarks like the Castillo de San Marcos, the oldest masonry fort in the United States, or stroll down the charming streets of Flagler College, a picturesque former hotel turned prestigious university. Beyond the Beaten Path: Uncovering St. Augustine’s Hidden Gems Venture beyond the popular attractions and discover hidden gems like the Tolomato Cemetery, the oldest documented burial ground in Florida, or the serene beauty of the Plaza de la Constitucion, the oldest public square in North America. Old Town Trolley Tours are not just educational; they’re also a fun-filled adventure for the whole family. Kids will love the open-air trolleys, engaging narration, and the freedom to hop on and off at different stops, allowing them to explore at their own pace. Stay at Southern Oaks Inn for Family-Friendly Adventures in St. Augustine Discover the joys of St. Augustine with family-oriented activities recommended by Southern Oaks Inn. Dive into a world of fun, from interactive ghost tours to delightful culinary explorations. Our guide to St. Augustine experiences is packed with options to engage every member of the family. Let us guide you to unforgettable moments and create cherished memories that your family will treasure forever. Book Now Innkeeper, Jake Brown Jake Brown serves as the Assistant General Manager at Southern Oaks Inn, bringing over 15 years of experience in the hospitality industry. His professional journey has encompassed a range of roles, including Management, Marketing, Group Sales, Concierge, and Front Desk Agent positions. Concurrently, Jake has dedicated himself to the live events industry since the age of 16, accumulating 26 years of experience in event planning, marketing, and performance roles.
